name: TrackMe
description: This application provides powerful capabilities to interact with TrackMe for Splunk Enterprise & Splunk Cloud.

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration

actions.verbose: This action allows retrieving the acknowledgement status for a given TrackMe entity.

object_category.description: The object category (splk-dsm, splk-dhm, splk-mhm, splk-cim, splk-flx, splk-wlk)
object_category.name: object_category

object_list.description: List of entities, in a comma separated format. Use * to retrieve all objects, defaults to * if not specified
object_list.name: object_list

actions.verbose: This action allows managing Acknowledgments for TrackMe entities, such as enabling, disabling or extending Acknowledgments.

object_category.description: The object category (splk-dsm, splk-dhm, splk-mhm, splk-cim, splk-flx, splk-wlk)
object_category.name: object_category

object_list.description: List of entities, in a comma separated format. If action=show and not set, will be defined to * to retrieve all Ack records, mandatory for action=enable/disable
object_list.name: object_list

action.description: The action to be performed, valid options are: enable | disable | show.
action.name: action

ack_comment.description: Relevant if action=enable but optional, the acknowlegment comment to be added to the records
ack_comment.name: ack_comment

ack_period.description: Required if action=enable, the period for the acknowledgment in seconds
ack_period.name: ack_period

ack_type.description: The type of Ack, valid options are sticky | unsticky, defaults to unsticky if not specified. Unsticky Ack are purged automatically when the entity goes back to a green state, while sticky Ack are purged only when the expiration is reached.
ack_type.name: ack_type

update_comment.description: A comment for the update, comments are added to the audit record, if unset will be defined to: API update
update_comment.name: update_comment

actions.description: Check and return the maintenance mode status
actions.verbose: This action allows retrieving the current TrackMe maintenance mode status.

example_values: Maintenance enabled for operation ref: xxxx
The global maintenance mode is currently enabled, alerts from TrackMe are not permitted

actions.verbose: This action enables the TrackMe global maintenance mode.

add_knowledge_record.description: Boolean value to indicate if a knowledge record should be added to the knowledge database, defaults to true
add_knowledge_record.name: add_knowledge_record

maintenance_duration.description: Duration of the maintenance window in seconds, if unspecified and maintenance_mode_end is not specified either, defaults to now plus 24 hours
maintenance_duration.name: maintenance_duration

maintenance_mode_end.description: Date time in epochtime format for the end of the maintenance window, it is overriden by maintenance_duration if specified, defaults to now plus 24 hours if not specified and maintenance_duration is not specified
maintenance_mode_end.name: maintenance_mode_end

maintenance_mode_start.description: Date time in epochtime format for the start of the maintennce window, defaults to now if not specified
maintenance_mode_start.name: maintenance_mode_start

time_format.description: Time format when submitting start and end maintenance values, defaults to epochtime and can alternatively be set to datestring which expects YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM as the input format
time_format.name: time_format

update_comment.description: Comment for the update, comments are added to the audit record, if unset will be defined to: API update
update_comment.name: update_comment

example_values: Maintenance enabled for operation ref: xxxx
The global maintenance mode is currently enabled, alerts from TrackMe are not permitted

actions.verbose: This action disable the TrackMe global maintenance mode.

update_comment.description: Comment for the update, comments are added to the audit record, if unset will be defined to: API update
update_comment.name: update_comment

example_values: Maintenance enabled for operation ref: xxxx
The global maintenance mode is currently enabled, alerts from TrackMe are not permitted

actions.verbose: This action retrieves the current operational status of the TrackMe tenants

tenant_id.description: Tenant identifier, do not specify a tenant identifier to retrieve the status of all tenants.
tenant_id.name: tenant_id

example_values: JSON object with jobs operation details

actions.description: Run a connectivity check for TrackMe remote accounts
actions.verbose: This action runs a connectivity check for TrackMe remote accounts which validates both network connectivity and authentication to the remote Splunk deployment.

account.description: TrackMe remote account name, do not specify any account to verify all configured accounts
account.name: account

example_values: remote search connectivity check was successful, service was established

actions.description: Requests Machine Learning models training for a given entity
actions.verbose: Programmatically train ML models for a given entity.

component.description: TrackMe component, valid options are: flx, dsm, dhm, mhm, wlk, cim.
component.name: component

actions.description: Runs Machine Learning Outliers monitor process for a given entity
actions.verbose: This actions runs TrackMe Learning Outliers monitor for a given entity.

component.description: TrackMe component, valid options are: flx, dsm, dhm, mhm, wlk, cim.
component.name: component

actions.description: Reset all ML outliers models for a given entity
actions.verbose: This actions resets ML models rules for a given entity.

component.description: TrackMe component, valid options are: flx, dsm, dhm, mhm, wlk, cim.
component.name: component

actions.description: Get ML Outliers models information for a given entity
actions.verbose: This action retrieves the key information for Machine Learning Outliers for a given entity.

component.description: TrackMe component, valid options are: flx, dsm, dhm, mhm, wlk, cim.
component.name: component

example_values: ML has sufficient historical metrics to proceed (metrics_duration=11+11:40:04, required=6days)

| mstats avg(trackme.splk.feeds.avg_eventcount_5m) as splk.feeds.avg_eventcount_5m where index="trackme_metrics" tenant_id="secops" object_category="splk-dsm" object="org_eu_linux:linux_secure" by object span="10m" | eval factor=strftime(_time, "%H") | fit DensityFunction splk.feeds.avg_eventcount_5m lower_threshold=0.005 upper_threshold=0.005 into model_249281506266661 by factor | rex field=BoundaryRanges "(-Infinity:(?<LowerBound>[\d|\.]*))|((?<UpperBound>[\d|\.]*):Infinity)" | foreach LowerBound UpperBound [ eval <<FIELD>> = if(isnum('<<FIELD>>'), '<<FIELD>>', 0) ] | fields _time splk.feeds.avg_eventcount_5m LowerBound UpperBound | stats count as metrics_count

| mstats avg(trackme.splk.feeds.avg_eventcount_5m) as splk.feeds.avg_eventcount_5m where index="trackme_metrics" tenant_id="secops" object_category="splk-dsm" object="org_eu_linux:linux_secure" by object span="10m" | eval factor=strftime(_time, "%H") | apply model_249281506266661 | rex field=BoundaryRanges "(-Infinity:(?<LowerBound>[\d|\.]*))|((?<UpperBound>[\d|\.]*):Infinity)" | foreach LowerBound UpperBound [ eval <<FIELD>> = if(isnum('<<FIELD>>'), '<<FIELD>>', 0) ] | fields _time splk.feeds.avg_eventcount_5m LowerBound UpperBound

actions.description: Add an exclusion period to a given ML model
actions.verbose: This action adds a period of exclusion for a given Machine Learning model.

earliest.description: The earliest time to be excluded in epoch time format
earliest.name: earliest

latest.description: The latest time to be excluded in epoch time format
latest.name: latest

example_values: Exclusion period for ML model was successfully added

actions.description: Get TrackMe entities realtime data and status
actions.verbose: This action returns the realtime TrackMe knowledge for a given TrackMe entity.

component.description: TrackMe component, valid options are: flx, dsm, dhm, mhm, wlk, cim
component.name: component

filter_key.description: Key identifier, multiple keys can be specified as a comma separated list of values. (you can use filter_object OR filter_key)
filter_key.name: filter_key

filter_object.description: Object identifier, multiple objects can be specified as a comma separated list of values. (you can use filter_object OR filter_key)
filter_object.name: filter_object

example_values: "Outliers ML for kpi="splk.flx.dcount_hosts", model_id="model_205090884007035", LowerBound="478.455" breached with kpi_metric_value="257.975" at time="2024-04-08 14:50:00.000 UTC", pct_decrease="46.08", Outliers ML for kpi="splk.flx.events_count", model_id="model_136982422509193", LowerBound="3697551.595" breached with kpi_metric_value="1758610.25" at time="2024-04-08 14:50:00.000 UTC", pct_decrease="52.44"

actions.description: This action allows managing TrackMe entities
actions.verbose: This action can be used to manage various aspects of TrackMe entities, such as enabling/disabling, deleting entities or maintaining components specific parameters using the extra_attributes JSON object.

component.description: TrackMe component, valid options are: flx, dsm, dhm, mhm, wlk, cim
component.name: component

filter_object.description: Object identifier, multiple objects can be specified as a comma separated list of values. (you can use filter_object OR filter_key)
filter_object.name: filter_object

filter_key.description: Keyid identifier, multiple keys can be specified as a comma separated list of values. (you can use filter_object OR filter_key)
filter_key.name: filter_key

action.description: The Action requested, valid options are: enable, disable, delete, manage_dsm_sampling, update_hours_ranges, update_wdays, update_priority, update_lag_policy, update_dcount_host, update_manual_tags
action.name: action

extra_attributes.description: A JSON object containing attributes for the action. For example, the action update_lag_policy could be asssociated with the following extra_attributes: {"data_max_delay_allowed": 7200, "data_max_lag_allowed": 900}
extra_attributes.name: extra_attributes

actions.verbose: The SmartStatus TrackMe action performs automated investigations in Splunk depending on the current status of the entity, and returns the key information for the entity anomalies detected.

component.description: TrackMe component, valid options are: flx, dsm, dhm, mhm, wlk, cim.
component.name: component

actions.description: Get TrackMe logical groups associations for a given TrackMe entity.
actions.verbose: This actions allows to retrieve and return the current associations information for a given TracKme entity.

filter_object.description: The TrackMe entity object identifier to search for and return Logical Groups association information.
filter_object.name: action

actions.verbose: This actions allows to manage TrackMe logical groups and perform association or unassociation of entities with Logical Groups.

action.description: The action to be performed on the logical group, valid options: show / associate / unassociate.
action.name: action

object_group_name.description: Logical Group name, required for action associate / unassociate, if performing association the logical group will be created if it does not exist yet.
object_group_name.name: object_group_name

object_list.description: Required for associate / unassociate, comma separated list of entities to be associated or unassociated with the Logical Group.
object_list.name: object_list

object_group_min_green_percent.description: For action: associate only, minimal green percentage for this group (for action: associate), if not specified, defaults to 50.
object_group_min_green_percent.name: object_group_min_green_percent

update_comment.description: A comment for the update, comments are added to the audit record, if unset will be defined to: API update
update_comment.name: update_comment
